item.title: Whats wrong?
item.dc:creator: @atrox atrox_
item.description:
@atrox wrote:

[quote=“ZeroFreeze, post:9, topic:318205”]Oh, come on.

float: center;  
width: 700;
height: 40;
background-color: #red;
<style type="text/css">
<html>
<body>
snip
</body>
</html>
<!DOCTYPE html PUBLIC "-//W3C//DTD XHTML 1.1//EN" "http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml11/DTD/xhtml11.dtd">
<html>
<div id="wrapper"></div>
<div id="logo"><center><a href="index.php"><img src="img/logo.png" border="0"></a></center></div>
<hr>
<img border="1" src="/img/helena.png" width="100" height="100" />

[code]

snip snip [/code]

All of that is completely wrong and horrible. Maybe you should grab a good webdesign book and LEARN before you share your half-assed creations with the world. That’ll solve the problem of your stuff looking bad in all browsers.[/quote]
which books would you suggest?

Read full topic

item.title: Whats wrong?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Now awhile back mitb gave me some advice to test my web pages on more than one browser so ive tried that with the one I’m currently working on, everything fine in chrome but in internet explorer the contents background doesn’t show up.

If you don’t mind I’m going to post the web page; http://mcr.ulmb.com/index.php

Also that the width and height of the content always isn’t what I tell it to be example:
width: 500;
height: 1000;
And it turns up full width on chrome but the height just changes each time I add something

Read full topic
